ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A intermediate Chinese class with a heavy workload. It depends on if the class is the right level for the student, which varies a lot so it probably depends on the placement test.
Highly recommend. It's a fun class, and you will learn a lot. It's incredibly well structured.

CHNS 140 is a course geared towards having students learn a number of new grammar structures and vocabulary words while also becoming more familiar with Chinese culture along with a variety of potential scenarios one could encounter when studying abroad in China. I would absolutely recommend this course in that it definitely helps one take the next step in becoming more comfortable with using the Chinese language.
